fixes.name: Date Sign
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR useCustom = SELECTEDVALUE('Use Custom Date'[Display As])
RETURN
IF(
    useCustom,
    IF(
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Max Date Exclude] = 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[EFFECTIVE_DATE],
        1,
        IF(
            'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[MAX_DATE -1day] = 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[EFFECTIVE_DATE],
            -1,
            0
        )
    ),
    IF(
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[EFFECTIVE_DATE] = SELECTEDVALUE('End Date'[Display As]),
        1,
        IF(
            'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[EFFECTIVE_DATE] = SELECTEDVALUE('Start Date'[Display As]),
            -1,
            0
        )
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the Tableau nested IF that references parameters into a DAX measure. Parameter references use SELECTEDVALUE('ParameterName'[Display As]) and row-level comparisons reference the table's columns.
fixes.type_changed_reason: This calculation references Tableau parameters ([Parameters]...), and per rules any parameter-based calculation must be created as a measure.

fixes.name: Delta Down All CCY 9M Diff
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR delta = 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Delta Down All CCY 9M]
VAR sign = 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Date Sign]
RETURN
delta * sign
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the Tableau multiplication of two fields into a DAX measure. References use the table-qualified column/measure names.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The expression depends on [Date Sign], which itself references parameters; per rules any parameter-based calculation must be a measure, so this calculation is a measure.
